H0.text: Rocks forming deep underground is a change that occurs only because of erosion and not because of weathering.

H1.text: Rocks become smooth and round is a change to the Earth's surface that occurs only because of erosion and not because of weathering.

H2.text: Rocks are broken apart into small pieces happen only because of erosion and not because of weathering.

H3.text: Rocks are moved from one place to another is the change that occurs only because of erosion and not because of weathering, even though both erosion and weathering cause changes to Earth's surface.

A4.text: Erosion is distinct from weathering which involves no movement.

A5.text: Erosion is the action of surface processes (such as water flow or wind) that removes soil, rock, or dissolved material from one location on the Earth's crust and then transports it to another location where it is deposited.
